item.title: Hypothesis 1
item.description: To test Hypothesis 1, we conducted word frequency analyses that quantify (1) variation in raw word counts over time and (2) the proportion of publications that the term is used in each year. These terms included various diversity-related terms, including aging, ancestry, cultural, diversity, genetic, minority, population, race/ethnicity, sex/gender and sexuality. Although we did not include religious and linguistic terms in our final visualizations, we did analyze these terms, finding little change in their use over time.

item.description: To test Hypothesis 3, we parsed our dictionary of 2,200+ population terms into a set of more nuanced analytic categories.
